signatures.desc: Starts a coroutine without a receiver and with result type T. This function creates and starts a new, fresh instance of suspendable computation every time it is invoked. The completion continuation is invoked when the coroutine completes with a result or an exception.

signatures.text: fun <R, T> (suspend R.() -> T).startCoroutine( receiver: R, completion: Continuation<T>)
signatures.desc: Starts a coroutine with receiver type R and result type T. This function creates and starts a new, fresh instance of suspendable computation every time it is invoked. The completion continuation is invoked when the coroutine completes with a result or an exception.
